problem.markdown:
1. A high magnitude alternating current can be measured by a combination of _________ and_________.
() A high magnitude alternating current can be measured by a combination of _________ and_________. () Current transformer and high range ammeter (x) Current transformer and low range ammeter () None
2. In a transformer, if N2 is number of secondary winding N1 is the number of primary winding then, if (N2/N1) ratio is equal to 1.It is called as ________
() Step up transformer (x) Isolation transformer () Step down transformer () All
3. The current transformer ratio is not equal to the ratio of secondary to primary turns.
() The above statement is false, because of the effect of magnetizing current () The above statement is false (x) The above statement is true, because of the effect of magnetizing current () None
4. Potential transformers are made with
(x) High quality icon core operating at very low flex density so that the magnetizing current may be very small () High quality icon core operating at very high flex density so that the magnetizing current may be very small () Low quality icon core operating at very low flex density so that the magnetizing current may be large () High quality icon core operating at very high flex density so that the magnetizing current may be large
5. In a transformer, if N2 is number of secondary winding N1 is the number of primary winding then, if (N2/N1) ratio is greater than 1.It is called as ________
(x) Step up transformer () Isolation transformer () Step down transformer () All
problem.p: 1. A high magnitude alternating current can be measured by a combination of _________ and_________.

choicegroup.choice: A high magnitude alternating current can be measured by a combination of _________ and_________.
Current transformer and high range ammeter
Current transformer and low range ammeter

problem.p: 2. In a transformer, if N2 is number of secondary winding N1 is the number of primary winding then, if (N2/N1) ratio is equal to 1.It is called as ________
3. The current transformer ratio is not equal to the ratio of secondary to primary turns.

choicegroup.choice: The above statement is false, because of the effect of magnetizing current
The above statement is true, because of the effect of magnetizing current
High quality icon core operating at very low flex density so that the magnetizing current may be very small
High quality icon core operating at very high flex density so that the magnetizing current may be very small
Low quality icon core operating at very low flex density so that the magnetizing current may be large
High quality icon core operating at very high flex density so that the magnetizing current may be large

problem.p: 5. In a transformer, if N2 is number of secondary winding N1 is the number of primary winding then, if (N2/N1) ratio is greater than 1.It is called as ________
